title: How to type special characters on a Mac - Quora

response.answer_text: To find special characters and symbols on a Mac click and hold your mouse or trackpad on the flag in the upper right side of the top menu bar. On the pull-down menu that appears select Emoji & Symbols. You will be presented with a list including special characters, symbols, basic emoji, and punctuation. Double-click on the desired to type it at the insertion point.

If you have macOS Mavericks, just press and hold the letter, just like you would on iOS. You’ll get a popup with your options:  You can also learn the option codes for the various symbols. For example, if you press shift-option-k, you’ll get an apple logo: . Want an accented e, press option-e and then e again: é. There is a handy chart here that can help you find the characters you want. As others have mentioned, you can also activate the keyboard viewer and just select the character you want.
